website_summaries.verdict: This quality BaByliss product is the only curling iron you need, and though not cheap, it's quite affordable.
pros: Versatile styling results with one barrel
cons: Some owners received faulty products, but they are in the minority

customer_reviews.title: The 1.25 is perfect for styling beachy waves in my shoulder length hair
customer_reviews.text: My hair is a little past shoulder length and I ordered both the 1.25 and 1.5 curling irons to style loose curly waves. I think the 1.25 definitely works best to achieve this style. The 1.5 barrel was just too big and did not hold or maintain my curl throughout the day (Although if your hair is considerably longer, the 1.5 might be a better curling iron for you). I have had these curling irons for well over a year and they have held up extremely well. They are strong, good quality, durable, and work great. I would absolutely recommend them to others!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Burns hair INSTANTLY
customer_reviews.text: Granted I have very fine hair, I purchased this product and tried it on the lowest heat - number 1. Recommended for fine hair. The iron instantly burned off the entire strand of hair. Absolutely horrifying.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda R. Fenstermacher

customer_reviews.title: The best curling iron!
customer_reviews.text: Works so great. Perfect size curl. Watch a video on YouTube And leave the ends out, it makes a perfect loose beach wave. Curls are even still good on day 2 with a little dry shampoo at the root and a soft brushing. Gets very hot so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Justmealicia

customer_reviews.title: Burned my highlighted hair
customer_reviews.text: I have blonde highlights & rarely ever straighten/curl my hair. After using this once, it not only took forever to actually make a curl, but in result left a weird brassy residue in my hair that will not come out. My hair dresser didn’t even know what to think of it. Also, after one use, my hair now smells TERRIBLE after i take a shower. Needless to say I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Corey LaMalva

customer_reviews.title: If you have thick Asian hair...go for this!
customer_reviews.text: I have straight Asian hair that cannot hold a curl. This curling iron is the answer to my problem! And it doesn't even have to be on the hottest setting. I get beautiful medium curls with this iron. I curled my hair and had no hair spray on because I didn't have any. The curls held up for about 3 hours which was unexpected! BaByliss has my loyalty now.
customer_reviews.author: BountyrollosTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Best curling iron for loose curls
customer_reviews.text: Best curling iron I’ve ever owned and I have owned my fair share. My hairstylist used it on me and I loved it so I had to buy my own!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Curls that last It's Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is amazing! I have the Babyliss pro straightener and this is definitely an upgrade! The curls are beautiful and sleek! The curling iron doesn't come with a manual but I found this as a guide for temperature settiings!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: The BEST iron I have EVER used.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews before buying this iron. People either loved it or hated it. My hair is thick, straight, and very hard to curl. This iron heats up instantly, slides through my hair with ease, and sets a perfect curl. Yes, it gets hot and you can adjust that down. Yes, the non-heated pointed tip is smaller than the usual barrel type, but I adjusted to it after only burning my fingers once! I had no issues with hair breakage, but I do not use the highest setting and only need to to curl each section for about 5 seconds to get the curl. I LOVE this iron!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I tried this curling iron! I have only used cheap ones up to this point but decided to splurge on this to see if there is a difference and I was thoroughly impressed! The iron is really smooth as you wrap your hair around it, and the lever for the clamp is in the perfect position for your thumb. A bit of pressure to the clamp and the hair slides through it easily (the cheaper versions aren't as smooth). The 1.25" made the most beautiful curls.... Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: happygirl5656

customer_reviews.title: Tripped circuit breaker, used less than 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: I had this iron for 9 months, used 3-4 times a month. In the middle of curling my hair on medium setting yesterday morning I felt a pop in the curling iron in my hand and it tripped the circuit breaker. I was so confused for a moment then I had to go outside in the freezing cold to reset it!!! I am not a risk taker and won’t be using this iron ever again! I do not want burnt hair or house fire. So disappointed and I wore my half curled ridiculous looking hair in a pony tail all day. Never in my life I had this happen.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: Died in 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I probably use this product once a week. It just stopped heating up. The light would indicate it was on/plugged in, but it would never get hot. I've never had a curling iron do that, so I can't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Burnt my hair off!
customer_reviews.text: So I thought I was the only one who experienced this but after reading SEVERAL reviews with people stating the same problem (burning hair off) I really think they should remove the product from amazon. This is not a true BayBliss product. I have fine hair and I had used on a low setting and burnt a very large chunk of hair off. I have NEVER experienced this before, it was completely horrifying and embarrassing. I would rather spend more money for a curling iron that’s the real deal. Please don’t buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Location of on/off button
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing product. For the price, I would have thought the placement of the on/off button would be better. I've used it twice, both times inadvertently hitting the on/off switch, turning the curling on off. I've already thrown away the packaging, otherwise I would return it. How hard is it to design a curling iron with a recessed on/off button?
customer_reviews.author: lrs

customer_reviews.title: The best curling iron!
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is amazing! I’m a total spaz & not an expert at all but this thing makes my hair look great! I was using an old curling iron and did not realize how terrible it was until I tried this. Gives me a beautiful wave that lasts for days. It’s unbelievable. My hair stays in the clamp while I turn it to Curl and slides right out easily. Heat adjustment is great and overall it’s amazing!
customer_reviews.author: WoodlandFairy

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my hair 😭
customer_reviews.text: So sad I didn’t end up loving this for my hair. I have pretty fine hair so when I would get to my ends — the barrel was too soft and my hair would slip thru. This means I wasn’t able to get all the way to my ends. I tried this against the hot tools. I returned this unfortunately. Still a great curling iron, just not perfect for my hair type! 💋
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: 5 STAR Product Right Here!
customer_reviews.text: These beach waves were made with the 1 1/4 and clean hair! Yeah, I didn’t even have to dirty up my hair so the curls would stay. Easy to use and didn’t take 1/2 the time it usually would take me using my flat iron. I put it on the 30 setting. I can say this is by far my FAV for making these gorgeous waves. Thank you BaByliss for making a great functional easy to use curling iron!
customer_reviews.author: A. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for thin hair
customer_reviews.text: Heats as expected, but I contacted seller when wand wound not hold my hair and clip appears to not clamp well. They allowed me to keep wand and sent a new one immediately. But, unfortunately it did the same thing. Not sure it’s meant for thin hair, but my old, other brand held hair with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Angela D. White

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I didn't leave too long so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product ! I didn't leave too long so I could get a more relax curl...
customer_reviews.author: felixa flores

customer_reviews.title: ** Makes great curls **
customer_reviews.text: Great curling iron by a reputable brand. I have thick, wavy hair to middle of my back. My hair doesn’t hold curls well due to the heaviness of my hair, but using this curling iron is probably the best my hair has ever looked. I bought the 1-1/4 inch as suggested by my hairdresser. The smaller barrel makes tiny tight curls and not what I desired. Gets VERY hot and makes beautiful curls fast...that holds. To get the best look, I have to blow out my wavy hair first then use it. Took off 1 star because the on/off button is in a rather bad location. Gets moved to off mode by accident when using.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2gr8tkid

customer_reviews.title: I got my hair cut and the stylist used a smaller iron and I was happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: I had a slightly larger (cheap) curling iron that I had used for some time and my hair would never hold a curl. I got my hair cut and the stylist used a smaller iron and I was happy with the results. So I went on line and found this one and thought I would give it a try. I LOVE this curling iron! It heats up fast, has a great grip and I love the handle. Everything about this curling iron is great. I have fine hair with highlights - very straight. I get so many compliments on my hair now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.text: This was awful. Curls were cute at first but fell out within an hour making my hair look stupid and disheveled at work :( my hair holds curl really well (2-3 days usually). I thought maybe I didn’t have the heat high enough ( I have thick, wavy hair). Turned it up and it smelled like the iron was burning my hair. Even with the higher setting the curls fell out qucikly. Just returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Big Body loose Curls
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful! This is my third Babybliss product. As usual it works perfectly. I wanted loose Big Curls & this is exactly what it gave me. I tried the CHI flat iron for a straight-look & it was a horrible experience. It did not Straighten my hair at all. I went over the same piece of hair several times Trying to straighten it with no avail. I have owned the Babybliss 1 inch flat iron for >4 years & it still works like a CHARM. If you have anything other than straight hair CHI is not for you. However, you will not be disappointed if you go with the Babybliss products. S.R. Ridley, #ANurseYouCanTrust
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Ridley, A Nurse You Can Trust

customer_reviews.title: Barrel is very short, end of barrel is tapered and hard to hold.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this curling iron but the barrel is very short compared to other curling irons I own. The plastic piece on the end of the barrel that you hold is tapered and hard to hold on to. I have to wear a glove in order to keep my fingers from burning because it's very awkward to use and I've burnt myself several times. The temperature settings are great but I really can't recommend this curling iron because it's not very easy to handle and because of how short the barrel is. I am going back to the Hot Tools brand.
customer_reviews.author: Fargonaut

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Is an awful, faulty product. Not saying saying that this specific product is such so, but that I’d be weary purchasing it from amazon. I’m happy that a good amount of people have seemed to have a had a decent experience with this purchase, but there a many that have not. Myself being one. Advise I have is to check on return dates!!! The window is stupid small!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: Another BaByliss masterpiece!
customer_reviews.text: I love BaByliss hair tools! Every one I’ve ever owned has been such high quality and I’ve never encountered and issue. I recently donated my hair and found myself wanting to continued to curl it but my previously used iron was far too large. This is the perfect barrel size for my hair and I’m looking forward to growing my hair out and continuing to use this iron!
customer_reviews.author: WashedUpWild

customer_reviews.title: Okay iron
customer_reviews.text: I guess this is a good iron, but not for me. The tip is too small plus it's sloped so I burn my fingers everytime I use it. I bought it because of a utube vid and it's the favorite of the girl doing the video. Its probably just me but I've gone back to my old iron.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Burns your hair OFF!
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with the positive. The curls this iron makes are long lasting. Now for the negative, it burns your hair off!!! First time I was like ok it's too high. Then another time it did it again. I thought I was tripping until the other reviews said the same. You literally have to have it on low to use. I used it on level 20 something and it still burned my hair. My whole house stinks. It's crazy! I'm not using it again
customer_reviews.author: MrsNewBeautie

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: This is literally THE BEST curler I have ever used. Why I waited so long to purchase this ...I don’t know. No more Walmart Revlon, Conair crap for me ! I have very fine hair that does NOT like to curl. This curls my hair beautifully in no time !!! And it lasts all day ! I didn’t know that could happen !!!! Highly recommend for hard to curl hair !!!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Gold

customer_reviews.title: Best curling iron
customer_reviews.text: 1 inch is best for mid length fine hair. I use it for curls or branch waves. It works fast and I iy works better than all the other high end curling irons I’ve tried. The salon that did my hair for my wedding used this item and my hair stayed curled and styled all day and night.
customer_reviews.author: Dazzleme

customer_reviews.title: Burns your fingers when you try to 'steady' the wand.
customer_reviews.text: Burns your fingers every time you touch the end of the barrel when you wrap your hair around the barrel. You use 2 hands, one to twirl the wand, and one to steady the barrel end of the wand. The barrel end burns the fingers every time, because the end is not round. It is flat and you can't grasp it properly. I'm stuck with mine because I let the month 'return' expired as I was saving it as a birthday gift. So if you insist on buying, try it out very quickly to make sure you can use it properly. .
customer_reviews.author: Texas Gal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent curling iron
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is HOT. I have thick hair that use to take forever to curl, not any more. If I had to change anything about it it would be that they make the tip a little bigger. The curling iron gets so hot and the tip gets pretty warm and isn’t quite big enough to grab without almost burning your hand.
customer_reviews.author: courtney chamness

customer_reviews.title: long cord
customer_reviews.text: only thing good about this curling iron is its long cord. fat handle - hard to hold; short tip - have burned my fingers every time I used It; clamp does not hold hair secure when curling - hair slides right thru. $10.00 iron I bought from Walmart is much, much better, but it does not have the long cord. nothing against seller or delivery - that was great. this is not a negative review about seller. would have returned, but lost packaging and did not find until after time was up to return.
customer_reviews.author: david dunn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, lightweight, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Amazing curling iron! It’s so lightweight and ergonomic for my hand. I have total control of the handle and the clamp is easy to open. My hair doesn’t snag in the clamp; it’s just so smooth I love it! I bought the 1.25” barrel and it was able to curl my medium-length bleached asian hair. I have coarse thick hair. The iron didn’t burn or damage my hair (I had the heat dial at 40 ≈ 390°F), but then again I have relatively healthy hair. I also used heat protectant spray.
customer_reviews.author: Ferra

customer_reviews.title: Great waves, stumpy barrel
customer_reviews.text: So I pretty much love the waves I get from this product - soft and beachy, just what I was looking for. Knocked off one star because the barrel is so short. The handle is insanely long and at least an inch or so of that length could've been added to the barrel instead as a lot of us long-haired gals buy these and the stumpy barrel is annoying. Also would love an auto shut off feature and would've paid a bit more to have one. But otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Birdieham

customer_reviews.title: It’s an average curling iron, nothing special
customer_reviews.text: I thought this curling iron was going to be great but unfortunately I received it and it’s an average curling iron. I’ve had high end ones and this is definitely average. I feel like the temperature is not as hot as it states it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Ann

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but....
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful curling iron. Very sleek and the color is my favorite. My hair would flow through it effortlessly and I really, REALLY wanted to love it. However, the curl would fall out of my hair within minutes of using it p, even when I set the temp higher. Also, the tip is much shorter than what I am use to and I burned myself several times because of it. I had to send it back. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm terrible at curling hair but I'm learning and this is the best curler I have ever personally used.
customer_reviews.author: charlea

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is amazing! The babyliss brand is just a great brand all around. My original shipment was lost by usps. I called the seller and they quickly turned around and sent me another one within a couple of days of reporting it. Although I was upset at usps for losing my first order I was very impressed with the seller for sending me one so fast! love how it curls my hair and curls last long. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Josie Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Not 450°!! Sturdy great quality but no heat
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Useless. Does not go up to 450 ° Doesn’t even curl my extensions. I can touch the curling iron and it’s hot but NOT 450° hot and the turbo button is a joke. Will return ASAP. Super easy to use. Great heat. I don’t see that it gets so hot that I can see steam, which I want, but it’s good. Sturdy, PERFECT size. The size down from the largest. Not too small not too big, but big enough.
customer_reviews.author: Newatit

customer_reviews.title: Barrel dimensions/width seem wrong
customer_reviews.text: This seems way larger than it’s supposed to be compared to similar models. I would have returned for a smaller one but packaging was tossed. Probably will sell via another site, as the barrel does not curl hair as well as the smaller sizes for my current length.
customer_reviews.author: N.N

customer_reviews.title: Not as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I returned the curling iron. I'd purchased it on recommendation from "TheSmallThingsBlog" as she described it as gliding through the hair really well to smooth out your curl. I was replacing a curling iron that was great about this, but I was interested in trying another brand. This iron barrel is quite short. In addition, it doesn't glide at all. It skipped down my hair shaft. I sent it back almost immediately. It did get nice and hot though, and might be good for shorter hair.
customer_reviews.author: Euharlee

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on my fine, straight hair
customer_reviews.text: I have very straight, very fine hair and this curled it well! I used it for my wedding and while the curls loosened, they stayed in all day. I used a low setting (less than 10) because I was worried about damaging my hair so it might hold longer if used on a higher setting. It definitely takes time and isn't the easiest to use but I was quite happy with the results. I would overall recommend this curling iron.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so much to like this curling iron, however, I think my hair may be too fine because my hair kept slipping out when trying to curl it. It would not curl my ends due to this. I did manage after multiple tries to get some curls done and the ones that worked the curls fell back out. I have a flat iron by this line and it works just fine. I eventually ended up returning the curling iron.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down best curler out there. I can not imagine NOT having this tool. So many hairstylists have it so I thought I would try it out. It is affordable, worth every penny! So easy to use, and the best thing is the results it gives! The best loose curls! Most importantly it does NOT pull out your hair or get your hair stuck in the barrel clamp! Recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and was super excited because so many people recommended it. I’m disappointed because the on/off button is so cheaply made, it will slide down to the off side while I’m curling my hair without me knowing. I have to turn the curling iron on and heat it up again for the second time in one sitting. It does this multiple times, that I get so frustrated and give up. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Averee Batis

customer_reviews.title: One of the better ones
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite so far! I have very fine hair and other curling irons (I've tried Solano, Conair, Hot Tools etc.) are harder to hold on to and pull my hair out. This one is user friendly and does not burn my fine hair. I will say thought that you have to watch the inside as when the ceramic coating wears off you it will start burning your hair.
customer_reviews.author: Klik

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews and purchased multiple curling irons to try what would be best. This curling iron is the winner! Not only decently priced but so much better!! I will continue to purchase this brand in the future. My hair looks healthier and I don’t have to hold the curling iron in my hair as long as I did previously. I have very soft hair, but this also works well on my daughters coarse hair.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Not for my hair type
customer_reviews.text: I'm ONLY giving this an "ok" review because it didn't do anything for my hair. I bought this after seeing multiple videos on Instagram of hairstylist giving this a rave review. My hair type + the material the barrel is made of = curl fallout. I really wanted to love this product but my curls fell out within an hour, even with hairspray. Works great otherwise, doesn't feel like a cheap iron like most do. Just disappointed is all.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Very good Curling Iron
customer_reviews.text: I have fine, thin, color-treated hair. This works well for me and doesn't damage my hair. I might have to use my thumb to put more tension on the clamp when curling (fine hair just slips right out) but I've always had to do that with curling irons. Very glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Clearcutter

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I was so tired of buying curling irons at retail stores that break, have control buttons that get in the way, pull out my hair or don't get very hot. I have shoulder length hair and needed a curling iron that would give me lasting curls. This one gets plenty hot and works great!
customer_reviews.author: S. Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Fast Loose waves, short barrel, small tip
customer_reviews.text: It took about 20 min for me to curl my hair. Not too bad considering i have very long thick hair. It looked great immediately after (pictured) but the curls loosened even more, so I think a smaller barrel would probably achieve this look after the curls settle. I’ll try using hair spray next time and see if that helps. As others mentioned, be careful with the limited grip at the and of the curling iron. There’s not much to hold on to. The barrel seems kinda short too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using cheap curling irons from the drugstore and wondering why my curls always fall. My hairdresser recommended this curling iron and I was immediately in love with it. I feel like it heats up faster and gets hotter, making my curls hold well and cutting styling time in half.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Product shorts out and will spontaneously burn off your hair!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by my hair stylist but, as many reviews confirmed, the company has changed the design. On my fifth use of the product, at the same temperature, I heard a snap, almost like an electrical noise. The product then spontaneously burnt off a significant section of my hair. Clearly, many of us have had the same experience. It will work until it doesn't. It may never burn off your hair. It may only burn off one section, one time, even though you're using the tool the same way as usual. Don't buy a product you cannot trust. This needs to be taken off the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST CURLING IRON I'VE EVER SEEN!!!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter wanted this for her 11th birthday present. She had never curled her hair and I was honored to have her ask me to teach her to curl her hair. I had boys, so now we both are learning new hairstyles. This was recommended on all of the YouTube channels for girls her age. Thank you very much!!!
customer_reviews.author: HealThySelf

customer_reviews.title: Gives me just the right curl size that I need which I love. Just make sure that you adjust the heat ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been searching for this brand for quite a while now because this is what I’ve been using for years but I had to toss my old curling iron already and replace it with this one. Gives me just the right curl size that I need which I love. Just make sure that you adjust the heat level and set it to your hair type, test the heat levels first from mid to max and check which temp your hair tolerates.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Regretful Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality of previous BaByliss products I have owned. I regret this “BaByliss” curling iron purchase for the following reasons: Despite a heat selector (dial), this thing runs VERY HOT all of the time despite setting on lowest heat. The temperature NEVER changes despite what the dial says. I fear burning hair. When turned off, handle stays warm; Tag recommends unplugging when not in use and turned off. Possible fire hazard if you forget to unplug. Plasticy and smaller thinner cord than on other owned BaByliss irons. Just not at all what I expected! Will purchase elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa-KYfan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Curls Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I love this curling iron. It gets extremely hot, and the titanium rod seems to work better for me than the one I was using. I have spent much more on a different brand and I hated it. This one is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Lurlene

customer_reviews.title: Not sure of authenticity
customer_reviews.text: In other reviews they discuss the max temperature, mine came with a click wheel? It's hard to read and honestly I have NO idea what temperature it is at so I guess and set it to not the max. Outside of that it works well. But given that i's probably a knock off I'd say it shouldn't be priced as the authentic product.
customer_reviews.author: madcowjm

customer_reviews.title: Needs a Better Design
customer_reviews.text: I cannot operate a curling iron using only one hand. I need to stabilize the barrel by holding on to the tip of the iron with my other hand while I control the major action with the first hand. Most curling irons hare a protected section to grab on to. This curling iron does not have that place to hold onto at the tip of the barrel. There is a small cone where one can put a finger tip to try to help stabilize the barrel. I tried to adapt to this method, but burned my fingers too often to keep the iron. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because this is the iron that my stylist uses. It heats up very quickly and gives you awesome curls. I figured it would be cheaper to do my own curls in between wash and curl days at the stylist and I am not disappointed so far. Great iron for thick hair as well. But be very careful as it does get piping hot!!
customer_reviews.author: Phenomenalme

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and have purchased all sizes or their curling irons. I e had one for over a year and it still works exactly like my new ones. My only issue The numbers on the heat dial wire off and I forgot which way was high. Not a big issue and I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Escape

customer_reviews.title: Works great gets very hot
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron works great! My hair is shoulder length and fine. It does get super hot even on the lowest temperature so I’d start there and see how your hair takes it. The tip gets hot too and I slightly burned my finger tips when I touched it. Overall I like this brand, I have a babyliss flat iron for over 10 years and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: JulianaRene

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work well.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using a Hot Tools Marcel for years but wanted to get a smaller barrel and this was recommended to me. It seems cheap. I had it plugged in for 5 minutes before using it and after a couple curls, it cooled way down. I had to unplug it and restart to get it back up to temp and my curls went straight within minutes. Returned! Going back to Hot Tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful curls for fine hair
customer_reviews.text: I have straight fine hair that takes forever to curl.. FINALLY I have found a curling iron that will make beautiful curls in my hair. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Not for fine hair
customer_reviews.text: My stylist had one at her salon and used it on my hair and the curls were beautiful! Hers was an older model. I took a chance & bought one. The curls were nice for about 2 hours and then just fell flat. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Muniz

customer_reviews.title: Good curling iron
customer_reviews.text: I got the 1.25” curling iron. I have fine hair and it’s thin (totally sucks). I like this curling iron because it is really easy to use. I feel like it definitely gets hot enough. My hair doesn’t hold a curl long but I really pretty curls from it. I was told to try ceramic curling iron since I have fine hair so I may be switching
customer_reviews.author: Beth A. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Love this iron
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I’d say I love a curling iron. My hair has become more fragile as it is very fine. I use at about 20 and it works perfectly. Glides through hair easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Ves

customer_reviews.title: Very professional styling tool!
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is the nicest one I’ve ever owned. Seriously an upgrade from cheaper brands. I have shoulder length wavy/curly hair and ordered the 1.5 in barrel. This gives me loose, piecey waves like I wanted. If your hair is thin or fine, this size barrel would not give you very defined curls so size down!
customer_reviews.author: MamaH

customer_reviews.title: May try a different barrel size
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 1.5-in barrel for my daughter and it must be too large to leave a curl/wave. She has long hair and loves the beach wave look so I bought this size based on what I read. Temp control dial was kind of hard to read, but it does get hot just fine. For some reason the curl just doesn't exist after unwrapping it from her hair. Thinking about trying the 1.25- or 1-in instead.
customer_reviews.author: Niece

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold a curl
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the hype. As soon as I'd finish one layer of curls and move on to the next, my previously curled strands would be flat! I've never had this issue before. I had the heat all the way up to 450, and used texture spray. Still went flat. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Britt K.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product can help you save a tre time. It heat up so fast and hold the curl so well. You have to make sure not burning your hair because it gets really hot. I only hold it for 5 seconds and still get the beautiful effortless look for my bob haircut. I Ike it a lot more the the Hot tools brand.
customer_reviews.author: Emmyline Tran

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Thats a really great curling iron id youd like beautiful curls that will last just get the smalest one.It does same curls as the medium one but the medium doesnt keep them for long the slim one keeps them for days.
customer_reviews.author: GreenS

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product-heats up quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product-heats up quickly, smoothes out frizz, and is easy to handle. The cord rotates at the bottom so that it will not wrap around the handle of the iron. It's extremely user friendly, and a pretty color. My only regret is the barrel size I ordered; I got the 1.5 inch when I really probably only needed the 1.25. It's wonderful nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Johnston

customer_reviews.title: The tip which remains cool and helps you hold o to the iron while ...
customer_reviews.text: The tip which remains cool and helps you hold o to the iron while you're curling the hair is very short and I constantly burn myself. Plus the clap that holds the hair around the iron gets looser as you get closer to the end and either the hair comes out or barely curls. Not fond of this curling iron and neither are the fingers that got burned,
customer_reviews.author: Pookie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS, so much!
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far.... the best curling iron I have owned. I have long hair and it's hard to curl when it keeps getting snagged or stuck in things. THIS DOESN"T HAPPEN WITH THIS ONE. I am so happy I finally broke down and bought this. I am a huge fan of the BaByliss products.
customer_reviews.author: E. Moe

customer_reviews.title: Safe to use on all types of hair.
customer_reviews.text: I love the multiple heat settings. I have fine hair and the lower temps are just perfect for the look and health of my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

customer_reviews.title: Great curling iron
customer_reviews.text: Gets hot fast. Curls and holds it all day in my coarse, Asian hair. (I use a protecting spray with it.) Doesn't leave a crimping mark. My only complaint is that the handle remains warm if it's plugged in but turned off so I unplug it everyday so as not be a hazard. Great curling iron.
customer_reviews.author: K J

customer_reviews.title: Beginner curl iron
customer_reviews.text: The easiest curler I have ever use I used to always get the drug store one but I thought to try this out since my hair dresser use this at her salon. This is by far the easiest and the most user friendly. If you are a beginner and you want to slowly improve your curling skills this is the iron for you
customer_reviews.author: Clara Hossain

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many positive reviews, I bought this one to curl my hair. I like how it heats up quickly and curls my hair easily. Only one downside I would say, it’s so heavy that my hand hurts while I’m doing my hair. I guess it’s something to do with its titanium spring, but I’d be more satisfied if it was a little lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Tsolmon

customer_reviews.title: Favorite curling iron
customer_reviews.text: I love this curling iron! My hair dresser actually recommended it to me because it's the one she uses on her clients. The size of the barrel is perfect to achieve my curls. It has a little stand so help it stay up and not burn the surface you're laying it on. It's easy to control the temperature and curls hair fast, as long as you're working w/ dry hair.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Baluyot

customer_reviews.title: Not for heat sensitive hair
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying two sizes because they were highly rated for heat sensitive hair. I used medium low heat and for only 5 seconds at a time. They burned my hair! I’ve only used them o ce each and my hair remains frizzy despite applying high price masks and conditioners.
customer_reviews.author: Oceansandlakes

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is a SUPER curling iron. I love the size for my shoulder length hair; the barrel helps to get a nice gentle curls/wave" look I enjoy for work days. It heats up fast, it does exactly what it's supposed to and every time! I couldn't be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Decent- the older model was so much better!
customer_reviews.text: This curling iron is okay. I used to have a previous model that worked MUCH better. I had the BaBylyiss Titanium Xtreme, that was discontinued and changed to this model. It get super hot, which is nice. I don't like how the clasp on the wand part isn't very right, and you hair slips through! It's not great but it bad.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Easy for short hair
customer_reviews.text: I had this curling iron used on my in a salon. I decided to order it for myself and it was perfect. I have short hair (growing out a pixie) and its the perfect size to use for subtle waves. Love love love
customer_reviews.author: LMWard

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold a curl in fine hair
customer_reviews.text: When I finally got a chance to use it, the curls in my hair didn’t last for more than one hour, no exaggeration. I bought the 1 1/2” and wish I would have bought the 1” for my fine hair . Not worth spending another $48 though to hope it works. This morning I was online getting ready to purchase another product from the same company and had an idea to check their authorized dealed. Amazon is NOT listed as one of them. Unfortunately the return window is closed and I’m stuck with this product and not something that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product. Even with using a few different freeze sprays I could not get the curl to hold on any heat setting. My hair is rather long and the barrel is too short to get heat to the whole strand. I was having to re-curl sections before I even finished another. The clamp isn't very tight either and my hair would fall leaving the whole process rather frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great temp control
customer_reviews.text: Love this curling iron! My hair is very fine so most curling irons are too hot. This one has a wide range of temp control, so I’m able to use it on the lowest heat setting. This curls my hair without damaging it! I highly recommend! Tip: if you feel it’s burning your hair, TURN DOWN THE TEMP
customer_reviews.author: Jinger H.

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the money, you will Definitely will like the results For your hair.
customer_reviews.text: Brought it for my daughter, who does hair to replace the exact one she had for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah b.

customer_reviews.title: Great heat and adds beautiful shine to my hair
customer_reviews.text: I've used many different curling irons over the years, and this one is the best, bar none. I have long, thick hair, and need a curling iron with a high heat option. After my ceramic Hot Tools iron stopped working, I decided to try BaByliss. After just one use, I noticed a huge difference. The titanium barrel made my hair super shiny and the curls held really well!
customer_reviews.author: Lori A.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great affordable curling iron! It doesn’t smell at first use and didn’t burn my hair at all. My hairstylist who is a social media influencer too suggested it and I’m so glad she did. Just be sure to use a good heat protector- salon brand.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this item-- long cord, heats quickly, long-lasting curl. Only complaint I have is the tip (where you need to put your fingers to hold) is short so my finger accidentally gets warm. Not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Luckylady

customer_reviews.title: Gets nice & hot quickly
customer_reviews.text: Great iron! I got the 1 inch and it’s perfect for making pretty waves and curls! To make it look more wavy leave 1-2 inches of the ends out and keep them straight, then brush through curls with fingers in the end and you’ll have the prettiest waves curl!
customer_reviews.author: K.A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this curling iron. I would definitely repurchase it if I needed to. I have had other curling irons damage my hair. My hair stylist recommended this brand to me.
customer_reviews.author: Judy M. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect curls everytime
customer_reviews.text: I have course, thick frizzy hair and this curling iron smoothes my hair, leaving beautiful shiny curls everytime
customer_reviews.author: BAM

customer_reviews.title: A dud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing a lot of positive reviews and not wanting to spend money on the T3. I ended up sending it back. Definitely not close to the T3 or my hot tools. Didn't work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: It curls, but slippery handle
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. The handle is slippery and the top rubber is too small, I use it to hold when curling and I still burnt my fingers. It does curl well, but still prefer ceramic hot tools or the knock off hot shot tools
customer_reviews.author: SGAGNON

customer_reviews.title: Nice size curls for fine shorter length hair
customer_reviews.text: Easy to open and close, easy to twist and make tendril curls. Heats up very quickly. Be sure to use the curling iron at its lowest setting for your hair. And use a hot tool/styling spray first to Keep your hair protected.
customer_reviews.author: Lookin' Pretty

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be better than others because it has that hot set button but that does not seem to make much of a difference. Also, the on off switch is easily switched to the off position unknowingly While using the iron
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS CURLING IRON. I’m a hairstylist and I am so picky about hot tools. Love this so much. I’m actually used to having a tip to hold onto and the tip on this is tiny. But it’s still great!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Linville

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Curling Iron
customer_reviews.text: I recently got extensions and this barrel is great for very long hair. You can do beach waves or curl your hair for a black tie event. I wouldn't recommend this size if you hair isn't at least to your mid/low back. I used it before the extensions with a little longer than shoulder length hair and the barrel was too large to get a nice curl. Great curling iron, easy to hold and use. Heats up quick.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Rittmaier

product_meta.title: BaBylissPRO Nano Titanium Spring Curling Iron
product_meta.description:
Size:1 InchThe BaBylissPRO Nano Titanium Spring Curling Iron creates loose waves or textured curls. The Nano titanium barrel uses far-infrared heat, heating the hair shaft from within for styling without damage. This iron has 50 heat settings up to 450F & has a turbo heat button to instantly boost heat output for faster results & more defined curls. It is available in 3/4", 1", 1-1/4", & 1-1/2" sizes depending on the desired curl size. This iron uses Sol-Gel technology which transforms nanoscale particles of titanium & ceramic from liquid to solid form, resulting in higher, more consistent concentrations of each. Sol-Gel barrels have a significantly higher percentage of titanium & ceramic compared to conventional barrels. As a result they are stronger, longer-lasting, & more resistant to chemicals.

BRAND STORY
BaBylissPRO is the world’s leading producer of innovative, high-performance professional styling tools. Chosen by hairdressers, barbers, and clients everywhere, BabylissPRO styling tools are versatile and engineered to last.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
